page.title: 19 LEWES REDEVELOPMENT
page.content: Known to generations of Lewes children as the{"Boneyard",}land close to the river is soon to have the big- gest{redevelopment}Lewes has ever seen Nineteenth century railway building replaced wooded ground here, but l950-60s closures of lines and goods yards left the surrounding land derelict apart from allotments. Starting l985,{Law courts}will be built where the station stood; {shops and supermarket}will open where there is now a carpark; new{carparks for 300 cars;{houses}for 300 people will grow where there are now allot- ments; and the woods, often liable to flooding from the Winterbourne, will contain{picnic spots}beside a{lake where boats can be hired. This will open up land near the heart of Lewes, now little known but soon to be full of activity.
